verses.verse: Keep silence <WH2790> before me, O islands <WH339>; and let the people <WH3816> renew <WH2498> their strength <WH3581>: let them come near <WH5066>; then let them speak <WH1696>: let us come near <WH7126> together <WH3162> to judgment <WH4941>.

Who raised up <WH5782> the righteous <WH6664> man from the east <WH4217>, called <WH7121> him to his foot <WH7272>, gave <WH5414> the nations <WH1471> before <WH6440> him, and made him rule <WH7287> over kings <WH4428>? he gave <WH5414> them as the dust <WH6083> to his sword <WH2719>, and as driven <WH5086> stubble <WH7179> to his bow <WH7198>. the righteous: Heb. righteousness
He pursued <WH7291> them, and passed <WH5674> safely <WH7965>; even by the way <WH734> that he had not gone <WH935> with his feet <WH7272>. safely: Heb. in peace
Who hath wrought <WH6466> and done <WH6213> it, calling <WH7121> the generations <WH1755> from the beginning <WH7218>? I the LORD <WH3068>, the first <WH7223>, and with the last <WH314>; I am he.
The isles <WH339> saw <WH7200> it, and feared <WH3372>; the ends <WH7098> of the earth <WH776> were afraid <WH2729>, drew near <WH7126>, and came <WH857>.
They helped <WH5826> every one <WH376> his neighbour <WH7453>; and every one said <WH559> to his brother <WH251>, Be of good courage <WH2388>. Be: Heb. Be strong

So the carpenter <WH2796> encouraged <WH2388> the goldsmith <WH6884>, and he that smootheth <WH2505> with the hammer <WH6360> him that smote <WH1986> the anvil <WH6471>, saying <WH559>, It is ready <WH2896> for the sodering <WH1694>: and he fastened <WH2388> it with nails <WH4548>, that it should not be moved <WH4131>. goldsmith: or, founder him: or, the smiting saying: or, saying of the soder, It is good
But thou, Israel <WH3478>, art my servant <WH5650>, Jacob <WH3290> whom I have chosen <WH977>, the seed <WH2233> of Abraham <WH85> my friend <WH157>.

Thou whom I have taken <WH2388> from the ends <WH7098> of the earth <WH776>, and called <WH7121> thee from the chief men <WH678> thereof, and said <WH559> unto thee, Thou art my servant <WH5650>; I have chosen <WH977> thee, and not cast thee away <WH3988>.

Fear <WH3372> thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed <WH8159>; for I am thy God <WH430>: I will strengthen <WH553> thee; yea, I will help <WH5826> thee; yea, I will uphold <WH8551> thee with the right hand <WH3225> of my righteousness <WH6664>.

Behold, all they that were incensed <WH2734> against thee shall be ashamed <WH954> and confounded <WH3637>: they shall be as nothing; and they <WH582> that strive <WH7379> with thee shall perish <WH6>. they that strive: Heb. the men of thy strife

Thou shalt seek <WH1245> them, and shalt not find <WH4672> them, even them <WH582> that contended <WH4695> with thee: they that war <WH4421> against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought <WH657>. them that: Heb. the men of thy contention they: Heb. the men of thy war
For I the LORD <WH3068> thy God <WH430> will hold <WH2388> thy right hand <WH3225>, saying <WH559> unto thee, Fear <WH3372> not; I will help <WH5826> thee.

Fear <WH3372> not, thou worm <WH8438> Jacob <WH3290>, and ye men <WH4962> of Israel <WH3478>; I will help <WH5826> thee, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068>, and thy redeemer <WH1350>, the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>. men: or, few men

Behold, I will make <WH7760> thee a new <WH2319> sharp <WH2742> threshing <WH4173> instrument having <WH1167> teeth <WH6374>: thou shalt thresh <WH1758> the mountains <WH2022>, and beat them small <WH1854>, and shalt make <WH7760> the hills <WH1389> as chaff <WH4671>. teeth: Heb. mouths

Thou shalt fan <WH2219> them, and the wind <WH7307> shall carry them away <WH5375>, and the whirlwind <WH5591> shall scatter <WH6327> them: and thou shalt rejoice <WH1523> in the LORD <WH3068>, and shalt glory <WH1984> in the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>.

When the poor <WH6041> and needy <WH34> seek <WH1245> water <WH4325>, and there is none, and their tongue <WH3956> faileth <WH5405> for thirst <WH6772>, I the LORD <WH3068> will hear <WH6030> them, I the God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478> will not forsake <WH5800> them.

I will open <WH6605> rivers <WH5104> in high places <WH8205>, and fountains <WH4599> in the midst <WH8432> of the valleys <WH1237>: I will make <WH7760> the wilderness <WH4057> a pool <WH98> of water <WH4325>, and the dry <WH6723> land <WH776> springs <WH4161> of water <WH4325>.

I will plant <WH5414> in the wilderness <WH4057> the cedar <WH730>, the shittah tree <WH7848>, and the myrtle <WH1918>, and the oil <WH8081> tree <WH6086>; I will set <WH7760> in the desert <WH6160> the fir tree <WH1265>, and the pine <WH8410>, and the box tree <WH8391> together <WH3162>:

That they may see <WH7200>, and know <WH3045>, and consider <WH7760>, and understand <WH7919> together <WH3162>, that the hand <WH3027> of the LORD <WH3068> hath done <WH6213> this, and the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478> hath created <WH1254> it.

Produce <WH7126> your cause <WH7379>, saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>; bring forth <WH5066> your strong <WH6110> reasons, saith <WH559> the King <WH4428> of Jacob <WH3290>. Produce: Heb. Cause to come near

Let them bring them forth <WH5066>, and shew <WH5046> us what shall happen <WH7136>: let them shew <WH5046> the former things <WH7223>, what they be, that we may consider <WH7760> <WH3820> them, and know <WH3045> the latter end <WH319> of them; or declare <WH8085> us things for to come <WH935>. consider: Heb. set our heart upon them

Shew <WH5046> the things that are to come <WH857> hereafter <WH268>, that we may know <WH3045> that ye are gods <WH430>: yea, do good <WH3190>, or do evil <WH7489>, that we may be dismayed <WH8159>, and behold <WH7200> it together <WH3162>.

Behold, ye are of nothing <WH369>, and your work <WH6467> of nought <WH659>: an abomination <WH8441> is he that chooseth <WH977> you. of nothing: or, worse than nothing of nought: or, worse than of a viper

I have raised up <WH5782> one from the north <WH6828>, and he shall come <WH857>: from the rising <WH4217> of the sun <WH8121> shall he call <WH7121> upon my name <WH8034>: and he shall come <WH935> upon princes <WH5461> as upon morter <WH2563>, and as the potter <WH3335> treadeth <WH7429> clay <WH2916>.

Who hath declared <WH5046> from the beginning <WH7218>, that we may know <WH3045>? and beforetime <WH6440>, that we may say <WH559>, He is righteous <WH6662>? yea, there is none that sheweth <WH5046>, yea, there is none that declareth <WH8085>, yea, there is none that heareth <WH8085> your words <WH561>.
The first <WH7223> shall say to Zion <WH6726>, Behold <WH2009>, behold <WH2009> them: and I will give <WH5414> to Jerusalem <WH3389> one that bringeth good tidings <WH1319>.

For I beheld <WH7200>, and there was no man <WH376>; even among them, and there was no counsellor <WH3289>, that, when I asked <WH7592> of them, could answer <WH7725> a word <WH1697>. answer: Heb. return
Behold, they are all vanity <WH205>; their works <WH4639> are nothing <WH657>: their molten images <WH5262> are wind <WH7307> and confusion <WH8414>.
